meanings.definition: To remove (living tissue or an organ) from its original site and implant it in a new site.
meanings.sent1: The surgeon explanted the heart from the patient's chest for transplantation.
meanings.sent2: The doctors explanted the kidney to save the patient's life.
meanings.sent3: The heart was explanted from one person and given to another; talk about a heart-to-heart conversation!
meanings.sent4: She explanted the idea from her mind and planted a new one in its place.
meanings.sent5: The image of the explanted heart beating in a different body stayed with her forever.
